title: Sunderland of Scotland Introduce Lifetime Waterproof Guarantee and“The Next Generation” CampaignTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Sunderland of Scotland Introduce Lifetime Waterproof Guarantee and“The Next Generation” Campaign  
Sunderland of Scotland is introducing a Lifetime Waterproof Guarantee in addition to launching “The Next Generation” campaign marking the next phase of the brand’s growth and development.
 
The Sunderland of Scotland brand, which is world renowned as the original weatherwear brand, will present the initiatives as part of the launch of their Spring Summer 2016 collection at The 2015 Golf Show in Harrogate. The brand has undergone a significant investment programme to pioneer cutting edge technologies and innovation in design, fabrics and functionality creating the most playable weatherwear the brand has ever produced.
 
Sunderland of Scotland’s Design and Buying Director, Ann Miller explains: “Sunderland of Scotland has a long history of supplying high performance garments and, as we move forward with our next generation programme, we’re proud to build on that tradition by incorporating new innovative waterproof fabrics such as our 4-way stretch WhisperdryTM range. By using superior fabrics and advanced construction techniques we are excited to introduce our lifetime waterproof guarantee on selected products, giving our customers complete confidence in our products”.
 
On the future of the brand which was founded when the Sunderland family began tailoring in Glasgow more than a century ago, Glenmuir Sunderland’s Managing Director Mikhel Ruia, said: “Whilst our team here in Lanark, Scotland are inspired and proud to be custodians of the brand that Toby Sunderland and his family started way back in 1911, the Sunderland of Scotland brand continues to develop, innovate and push the boundaries of weatherwear design”.
 
Your area sales representative will be on hand to present the Glenmuir and Sunderland of Scotland collections and our exclusive show offers and promotions at The 2015 Golf Show in Harrogate.
Source:- IAGTO
